solution_line_template: The weekly salary of Agnes is ${agnes_hourly_rate} x {agnes_weekly_hours} = ${agnes_weekly_salary}{agnes_weekly_salary}.
So in a month, Agnes earns ${agnes_weekly_salary} x {weeks_per_month} = ${agnes_monthly_salary}{agnes_monthly_salary}.

Therefore, Mila needs to work for ${agnes_monthly_salary} / ${mila_hourly_rate} = <<{agnes_monthly_salary}/{mila_hourly_rate}={mila_hours_needed}>>{mila_hours_needed} hours to earn as much as Agnes's monthly earnings.
